content:
that it is not morally required of anyone that he give
long stretches of his life—nine years or nine months—to sustaining the life
of a person who has no special right (we were leaving open the possibility
of this) to demand it.
Indeed, with one rather striking class of exceptions, no one in any coun-
try in the world is legallyrequired to do anywhere near as much as this for
anyone else. The class of exceptions is obvious. My main concern here is not
the state of the law in respect to abortion,
